title: Thibaut Courtois scores a belter that suggests Chelsea's GOALKEEPER might be their best free-kick taker
text:
Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Antonio Conte has already proven that he is prepared to be an innovative Chelsea manager. 
The switch to 3-4-3, bringing Victor Moses in from the cold, convincing Diego Costa that anger is not always the best solution… the Italian coach is clearly a man who is willing to make some bold calls. 
So, when he sees the clip above, don't be too surprised if Conte suddenly decides that his GOALKEEPER is going to start taking Chelsea's direct free-kicks. 
That might sound ridiculous… but once you see the worldie Thibaut Courtois scores in the video, you will see why the Belgian keeper deserves his chance to shine. (Photo: Twitter/@thibautcourtois) (Photo: Darren Walsh) 
Stepping up in training, the 24 year-old stopper doesn't just score with his free-kick from 25 yards out. 
He absolutely NAILS his strike. His shot flies into the 'top bin' (the term today's hip young kids use to describe the top corner). It even rattles in off the crossbar, to give it an added injection of awesomeness. (Photo: Twitter/@thibautcourtois) 
It is a belter . 
And while the idea of a goalkeeper taking direct free-kicks might seem a little unlikely, there is another reason some Chelsea fans wouldn't mind seeing Courtois given an opportunity. 
It would mean they wouldn't have to watch David Luiz bang another 15 efforts into the wall/the stand before he finally scores another corker… *sigh* (Photo: Rex)
